keywords.term: poetry lyric hymn with musical mode

revisionDesc.change: Submit - The text was not appearing in the HTML although it is present in the XML. Thus, I'm submitting it again.
Finalized - This is good to go.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - TEXT: regularize the two words in r.4 separately; add braces to second τῷ in r.6; add braces to τῶ<ν> in r.10; in r.13 I prefer the braces around sigma instead of regularization; in r.19 I think *filler(extension)* is better; regularize the words in v.22 separately; also dot the tau of the article in v.26; make sure there’s no extra space at the start of v.29; regularize separately in v.31; in v.34 replace " with *slanting-stroke**slanting-stroke*; lines v.35-41 should be encoded along the (X,ms, perpendicular) paradigm; regularize separately in v.37; add space before τριή at end of v.38; regularize in v.40/41 separately. META: update title; Arsinoites is https://pleiades.stoa.org/places/736893; image links are (https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/ManchesterDev~93~3~55548~224221:Byzantine-hymns?sort=reference_number%2Cimage_sequence_number%2Cimage_title%2Cimage_number) AND (https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/ManchesterDev~93~3~55549~224220:Byzantine-hymns?sort=reference_number%2Cimage_sequence_number%2Cimage_title%2Cimage_number)

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - TEXT: regularize the two words in r.4 separately; add braces to second τῷ in r.6; add braces to τῶ<ν> in r.10; in r.13 I prefer the braces around sigma instead of regularization; in r.19 I think *filler(extension)* is better; regularize the words in v.22 separately; also dot the tau of the article in v.26; make sure there’s no extra space at the start of v.29; regularize separately in v.31; in v.34 replace " with *slanting-stroke**slanting-stroke*; lines v.35-41 should be encoded along the (X,ms, perpendicular) paradigm; regularize separately in v.37; add space before τριή at end of v.38; regularize in v.40/41 separately. META: update title; Arsinoites is https://pleiades.stoa.org/places/736893; image links are (https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/ManchesterDev~93~3~55548~224221:Byzantine-hymns?sort=reference_number%2Cimage_sequence_number%2Cimage_title%2Cimage_number) AND (https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/ManchesterDev~93~3~55549~224220:Byzantine-hymns?sort=reference_number%2Cimage_sequence_number%2Cimage_title%2Cimage_number)

General - sorry, text unfortunately submitted before finishing comment, which continues here: ...33 after μεγαλύνομεν. lin14-15 please check my encoding of the problem about ὑγιάστας. lin16 κυρίου strange enough unabbreviated (see lin5, 12). Has it been read correctly, I hardly recognize the word. Note: lin35-41 are at right angles to the rest of the text, on the left side: how to encode??

Submit - Encoded Greek text from P.Ryl.3.466 (TM 65449). General remark: supralines not always clear in abbreviations, e.g. lin23 στ(αυ)ρουθεντα, no foto of verso available? On several places there are signs/symbols which I cannot identify: lin4 after πετες, lin20-21, in which I recognize some numbers, lin
